Data table

Use a data table to display (large quantities of) related data in a structured way.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-data-table

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-data-table

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-data-table/src/scss/data-table";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Import JS

                  
                  import { Datatable } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-data-table';

By default, there is no sorting functionality available for the data table. The visual mark-up is provided by default. Add the modifier - sortable to the header title element. When the sorting is selected, the modifier - sortable - active can be added. When using a rowspan, ensure that each row in the table has the .data-table__grouped-row class. Place the table inside a container with the .u-table overflow class. This ensures that the table is also easy to view on tablet / mobile. To give columns a fixed or percentage width, add a style to the <tr> elements. Do this only for columns with fixed content, e.g. a first row of checkboxes.

Datatable actions - Data attributes - [data-table]

  • Make sure the data-table attribute is available as a wrapper around the table, table actions and pagination so that all options are available.
  • [data-row-selectable]
  • Add the data-row-selectable attribute to the table rows <tr> to match the select behavior of the checkbox in the row by selecting the entire element.
  • [data-table-checkbox]
  • Add the data-table-checkbox attribute to the checkboxes within the <tr> row to use the correct selection behavior.
  • [data-table-checkbox-all]
  • Add the data-table-checkbox-all attribute to the checkbox in the <thead> to add the "select all checkboxes" functionality. This ensures that large amounts of data can be quickly and efficiently selected.

Accessibility Throughout the code example, <span> elements with the .u-visually-hidden class are often used where the function of the element is explained. This is read by screen readers so that visually impaired people can use the component.

Data table hover

Use the hover variant to highlight a row when hovering over it with the mouse pointer.

Data table hover
Entry Header 1 Entry Header 2 Entry Header 3 Entry Header 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4 
      
<table class="vl-data-table vl-data-table--hover">
  <caption>Data table hover</caption>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Entry Header 1</th>
    <th>Entry Header 2</th>
    <th>Entry Header 3</th>
    <th>Entry Header 4</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr >
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 1</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 2</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 3</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 4</td>
      </a>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <td >Entry line 1</td>
    <td colspan="2" scope="colgroup">Entry line 2</td>
    <td >Entry line 3</td>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <a href="#">
      <td >Entry line 1</td>
      <td >Entry line 2</td>
      <td >Entry line 3</td>
      <td >Entry line 4</td>
    </a>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

Data table Matrix

Use the matrix variant to display data with 2 dimensions. The rows as well as the columns get a title. The titles are separated from the content with a bold line.

Data table Matrix
Entry Header 1 Entry Header 2 Entry Header 3 Entry Header 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4 
      
<table class="vl-data-table vl-data-table--matrix">
  <caption>Data table Matrix</caption>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Entry Header 1</th>
    <th>Entry Header 2</th>
    <th>Entry Header 3</th>
    <th>Entry Header 4</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr >
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 1</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 2</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 3</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 4</td>
      </a>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <td >Entry line 1</td>
    <td colspan="2" scope="colgroup">Entry line 2</td>
    <td >Entry line 3</td>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <a href="#">
      <td >Entry line 1</td>
      <td >Entry line 2</td>
      <td >Entry line 3</td>
      <td >Entry line 4</td>
    </a>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

</table>

Data table with an Action block

You can add an Action block above a data table. For large tables, the Action block can also be placed below the tabel. Action buttons can be linked to the table here. - Left side - Add the data attribute [data-table-action] and the correct aria tags (cf. code example) to the .data-table__action list item in order to make the button visible only when one or more rows in the table are selected. Assign standard actions, such as "adjust" or "delete" to this button. Or add an export function, e.g. export as PDF.

  • Right side - Add a button (optional) that converts the table into a list, e.g. in a Drilldown component.
  • Top / Bottom - Add .data-table__actions-top or .data-table__actions-bottom to the .data-table__actions DOM element to ensure that the correct margins are assigned to the top and bottom actions.
Data table with an Action block
Entry Header 1 Entry Header 2 Entry Header 3 Entry Header 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
    • PDF document
    • Excel document
    • CSV file
    • JSON file 
      
<table class="vl-data-table vl-data-table--hover">
  <caption>Data table with an Action block</caption>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Entry Header 1</th>
    <th>Entry Header 2</th>
    <th>Entry Header 3</th>
    <th>Entry Header 4</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr >
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 1</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 2</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 3</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 4</td>
      </a>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <td >Entry line 1</td>
    <td colspan="2" scope="colgroup">Entry line 2</td>
    <td >Entry line 3</td>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <a href="#">
      <td >Entry line 1</td>
      <td >Entry line 2</td>
      <td >Entry line 3</td>
      <td >Entry line 4</td>
    </a>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
  <div class="vl-data-table__actions vl-data-table__actions--bottom">
    <ul class="vl-data-table__actions__list">
      <li class="vl-data-table__action">
        <div class="vl-popover  vl-popover--left" data-vl-popover>
  <button class="js-vl-popover__toggle vl-popover__toggle" type="button" aria-expanded="false">
    Downloaden
    <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-u-badge vl-vi-u-badge--grey vl-vi-u-badge--small vl-vi-arrow vl-vi-u-90deg" aria-hidden="true"></i>
  </button>
<div class="vl-popover__content" >
          <ul class="vl-popover__link-list">
              <li class="vl-popover__link-list__item">
                <a href="#" class="vl-link vl-link--block">
                  PDF document
                </a>
              </li>
              <li class="vl-popover__link-list__item">
                <a href="#" class="vl-link vl-link--block">
                  Excel document
                </a>
              </li>
              <li class="vl-popover__link-list__item">
                <a href="#" class="vl-link vl-link--block">
                  CSV file
                </a>
              </li>
              <li class="vl-popover__link-list__item">
                <a href="#" class="vl-link vl-link--block">
                  JSON file
                </a>
              </li>
          </ul>
      <button class="vl-popover__close-btn vl-vi vl-vi-cross" tabindex="0">
        <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">close popover</span>
      </button>
    </div>
  </div>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>

Data table collapsed on breakpoint

The table will collapse on breakpoint (medium, small or xsmall) to allow a better visualisation of table elements on smaller-sized screens. For example: adding vl-data-table--collapse-m modifier class to the table element will let the table break on medium-sized screens. Other modifiers you can use for small and xsmall breakpoints are: vl-data-table--collapse-s and vl-data-table--collapse-xs Make sure to also add data-title attribute to each table definition (<td>). This attribute is necessary for restucturing the data-table. All elements will collapse and be stacked on top of each other with their respective title.

Data table collapsed on breakpoint
Entry Header 1 Entry Header 2 Entry Header 3 Entry Header 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4 
      
<table class="vl-data-table vl-data-table--collapsed-m">
  <caption>Data table collapsed on breakpoint</caption>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Entry Header 1</th>
    <th>Entry Header 2</th>
    <th>Entry Header 3</th>
    <th>Entry Header 4</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr >
      <a href="#">
        <td data-title="Entry Header 1">Entry line 1</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td data-title="Entry Header 2">Entry line 2</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td data-title="Entry Header 3">Entry line 3</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td data-title="Entry Header 4">Entry line 4</td>
      </a>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <td data-title="Entry Header 1">Entry line 1</td>
    <td data-title="Entry Header 2"colspan="2" scope="colgroup">Entry line 2</td>
    <td data-title="Entry Header 3">Entry line 3</td>
  </tr>
  <tr >
    <a href="#">
      <td data-title="Entry Header 1">Entry line 1</td>
      <td data-title="Entry Header 2">Entry line 2</td>
      <td data-title="Entry Header 3">Entry line 3</td>
      <td data-title="Entry Header 4">Entry line 4</td>
    </a>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

Data table success, warning & error state

You can add modifiers to table elements to enable a success, warning or error state. For example: adding vl-data-table__element--error modifier class to a table row (tr) will add an error state to attract the user's attention in case of erroneous input for example.

Data table success, warning & error state
Entry Header 1 Entry Header 2 Entry Header 3 Entry Header 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3
Entry line 1 Entry line 2 Entry line 3 Entry line 4 
      
<table class="vl-data-table vl-data-table--hover">
  <caption>Data table success, warning &amp; error state</caption>
  <thead>
  <tr>
    <th>Entry Header 1</th>
    <th>Entry Header 2</th>
    <th>Entry Header 3</th>
    <th>Entry Header 4</th>
  </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
  <tr class="vl-data-table__element--error">
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 1</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 2</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 3</td>
      </a>
      <a href="#">
        <td >Entry line 4</td>
      </a>
  </tr>
  <tr class="vl-data-table__element--warning">
    <td >Entry line 1</td>
    <td colspan="2" scope="colgroup">Entry line 2</td>
    <td >Entry line 3</td>
  </tr>
  <tr class="vl-data-table__element--success">
    <a href="#">
      <td >Entry line 1</td>
      <td >Entry line 2</td>
      <td >Entry line 3</td>
      <td >Entry line 4</td>
    </a>
  </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

Accessibility

The best tables are simple tables. Avoid merged cells so that each row has the same number of cells. Also, avoid empty cells.
